resources.string: Remember that text you shouldn\'t have sent last night? We do.
URL of the RSS you like:
Or, if unsure, try one of these cool feeds:
Number of items to store in the memory:

If you want to see more TFLN stories, add the widget to your homescreen. At the beginning you will have few entries, but it will update often and you will not miss any TFLN!\n\n
To add this widget to your home screen: long-press in an empty area, select \"Widgets\" and tap on \"Texts From Last Night\".

We are two developers, Omar Pera Mira and Pablo Pera Mira, with some spare time to spend on having fun with the Android platform. Find us on http://www.androidsx.com or send us an e-mail to android.sx@gmail.com!

This application is licensed under the Apache 2.0 license.

We have borrowed a lot of knowledge, and also code licensed under Apache 2.0 from Jeff Sharkey great blog, http://jsharkey.org/.

None of the content that this widget fetches from RSS feeds is under our responsibility.

v2.3 (21.01.2011, current version)
 - Little FAQ at startup
 - Increase maximum number of stories per request
 
 v2.2.1 (19.11.2010)
 - Performance improvement for slow of overloaded devices
 
 v2.2 (30.10.2010)
 - Fix bug in list view
 - Add about module
 
 v2.1 (21.05.2010)
 - Full texts in list view
 
 v2.0 (20.04.2010)
 - Open as an application! (but in widget more items are saved!)
 - More robust and stable
 - Share text, copy
 
 v1.9 (24.03.2010, current version)
 - Set how many stories will be stored in memory (50 default)
 
 v1.8 (05.03.2010)
 - Stores up to 50 stories
 - Improve update inverval selection view
 - Minor improvements for the error handling
 
 v1.7 (12.02.2010)
 - Submit TFLN texts (press menu when browsing texts)
 
 v1.6 (5.02.2010)
 - Added options when user clicks an item in list view: go to url, share and go to item mode
 
 v1.5 (29.01.2010)
 - Details view loads faster
 - Disable auto-scroll (will be restored with a battery-saving mechanism)
 - Preferred view style is remembered after restart
 
 v1.4 (19.01.2010)
 - New size: 2x4
 - Autoscroll for the widget view
 - Open URL button is easier to find
Or at least the stuff in bold
This app is a widget, so add it to your home screen.
The widget updates every two hours. We don\'t want to waste battery! To refresh at any time:
We\'ll keep 100 items in the SD card. Wait a few hours to have them all downloaded.
